xxl.core.io.converters
Class IntegerConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter<T>
          xxl.core.io.converters.FixedSizeConverter<Integer>
              xxl.core.io.converters.IntegerConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class IntegerConverter
extends FixedSizeConverter<Integer>

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write Integer objects. In addition to the read and write methods that read or write Integer objects this class contains readInt and writeInt methods that convert the Integer object after reading or before writing it to its primitive int type.

Example usage (1). 

   // create a byte array output stream

   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();

   // write an Integer and an int value to the output stream

   IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), 42);
   IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.writeInt(new DataOutputStream(output), 666);

   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream

   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());

   // read an int value and an Integer from the input stream

   int i1 = IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.readInt(new DataInputStream(input));
   Integer i2 = IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));

   // print the value and the object

   System.out.println(i1);
   System.out.println(i2);

   // close the streams after use

   input.close();
   output.close();

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final IntegerConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of IntegerConverter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of IntegerConverter.

SIZE

public static final int SIZE
This field contains the number of bytes needed to serialize the int value of an Integer object. Because this size is predefined it must not be measured each time.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

IntegerConverter

public IntegerConverter()
Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)

Method Detail

read

public Integer read(DataInput dataInput,
                    Integer object)
             throws IOException
Reads the int value for the specified (Integer) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.
This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new Integer object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.

Specified by:
read in class Converter<Integer>
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the int value from in order to return an Integer object.
object - the (Integer) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read Integer object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

readInt

public int readInt(DataInput dataInput)
            throws IOException
Reads the int value from the specified data input and returns it.
This implementation uses the read method and converts the returned Integer object to its primitive int type.

Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the int value from.
Returns:
the read int value.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Integer object)
           throws IOException
Writes the int value of the specified Integer object to the specified data output.
This implementation calls the writeInt method of the data output with the int value of the object.

Specified by:
write in class Converter<Integer>
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the int value of the specified Integer object to.
object - the Integer object that int value should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeInt

public void writeInt(DataOutput dataOutput,
                     int i)
              throws IOException
Writes the specified int value to the specified data output.
This implementation calls the write method with an Integer object wrapping the specified int value.

Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the specified int value to.
i - the int value that should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
The main method contains some examples how to use an IntegerConverter. It can also be used to test the functionality of an IntegerConverter.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
